channel.title: For those of why it says server is offline needs to be online to register ithere
channel.description: hello, i have recently had problems registering if you are one of THOSE PEOPLE that it says its not online it needs to be online to register it... then type in your default gateway in the address of your browser http://192.168.1.1/ and then enter the password and username if you have one if it doesnt work try username admin password password or if not leave the username blank and type in the password admin and then if it works ill give the one for linksys ok go to applications and gaming use the application of what you want of your choice and the start port 43594 and end port 43594 and then the protocol tcp then the ip idk if it makes a difference what you put just put the 3 letters of the ip it gives to the left which would probably be 192 it worked for me....file:///C:/Users/connor/Desktop/Forward.htm then try to register the server .... if it still doesnt work, go onto administration on that page and then enable remote management and then type in that port box 43594 and then enable use https then click save settings it worked for me!!!! file:///C:/Users/connor/Desktop/Manage.htm thanks i hope i explane good enough that was the only problem i didnt understand lol so i thought you guys didnt thanks hope i helped!!!! btw copy/paste the file:///c; thing into your addres bar of your browser sorry it dditn go through

item.title: For those of why it says server is offline needs to be online to register ithere
item.dc:creator: @alancarr123 alancarr123
item.description:
@alancarr123 wrote:

This is also known as Portforwarding.

im 0nlyy, i think this goes on a bit to much would be more useful if pictures were added.
Hehe don’t forget your fullstops.

Read full topic

item.title: For those of why it says server is offline needs to be online to register ithere
item.dc:creator: @im_0nlyy im 0nlyy
item.description:
@im_0nlyy wrote:

hello, i have recently had problems registering if you are one of THOSE PEOPLE that it says its not online it needs to be online to register it… then type in your default gateway in the address of your browser http://192.168.1.1/ and then enter the password and username if you have one if it doesnt work try username admin password password or if not leave the username blank and type in the password admin and then if it works ill give the one for linksys ok go to applications and gaming use the application of what you want of your choice and the start port 43594 and end port 43594 and then the protocol tcp then the ip idk if it makes a difference what you put just put the 3 letters of the ip it gives to the left which would probably be 192 it worked for me…file:///C:/Users/connor/Desktop/Forward.htm then try to register the server … if it still doesnt work, go onto administration on that page and then enable remote management and then type in that port box 43594 and then enable use https then click save settings it worked for me!!! file:///C:/Users/connor/Desktop/Manage.htm thanks i hope i explane good enough that was the only problem i didnt understand lol so i thought you guys didnt thanks hope i helped!!! btw copy/paste the file:///c; thing into your addres bar of your browser sorry it dditn go through

Read full topic
